messages.message:
Deployment integration feedback:
• Deleting integrations doesn't require confirmation. This seems like it has a high potential to cause dissatisfaction for end-users ~(especially given that deployment changes are auto-saved.)~
    ◦ Is integration deletion confirmation something we can/should incorporate?
• IIRC, we used to allow configuring more than 1 upstream integration but it looks like that's not possible today.
    ◦ Does this seem like something we should support?
cc @Paul H @Weiming Wu Should we create a ticket to address?

~EDIT: looks like deployments are NOT auto saved. I found the `save` button way at the bottom, but not on the right side of the UI as I normally expected.~

~I still think it could be helpful to discuss/implement these changes~ :slightly_smiling_face:

Actually, it seems like some things are auto-saved and others are not. For example, deleting an upstream integration does require MANUAL saving, but deleting a downstream integration AUTO-SAVES.
Also not sure about the allowing more than 1 upstream integration at a time, maybe @jack.robbins has more context

Thanks for sharing this feedback (all great points btw!) - mind if we reach out separately, as this is an area of research we're working on currently for https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-3556 & a few other initiatives? cc @Siya

update:
It seems like some things are auto-saved and others are not. For example, deleting an upstream integration does require MANUAL saving, but deleting a downstream integration AUTO-SAVES.

@jack.robbins additional feedback:
Adding multiple email addresses to a deployment notification (email) isn't consistent with other bulk add/listing mechanisms elsewhere in the platform (ie inviting members to org)

SS2:
• Trying to add other members using the `,` + `tab` (or even `enter`) throws an error
• deleting the first character of the plain text string (not yet captured as an email address) seems to also delete the address correctly captured as an entity also? 
• It could be nice to be able to add/access a list of members in the deployment's host workspace to add/choose from
(dumping thoughts here before it gets lost in my mental void :slightly_smiling_face:)
When editing a preconfigured email notification, unless you add or remove an email address from the recipient list, the `send test` option is greyed out and not functional.
